Term_Definition: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids. If the sample is used for metagenomics add "metag"
Total number of clones sequenced from the library
Specify whether to expect single, paired, or other configuration of reads
Required_value_and_units: text, select from the list: SINGLE, PAIRED

Term_Definition: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies (e.g. for metabarcoding). If the sample is used for metagenomics add "metag"
Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA. If the sample is used for metagenomics add "metag"
The length of the amplicon in basepairs. If the sample is used for metagenomics add "metag"

PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters. If the sample is used for metagenomics add "metag"
Required_value_and_units: text (FWD: forward primer sequence;REV:reverse primer sequence)

Term_Definition: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters
Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters
Description of reaction conditions and components of PCR in the form of  'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'. If the sample is used for metagenomics add "metag"

Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA,ENA or DRA
Sequencing method used; e.g. Sanger, pyrosequencing, ABI-solid
DNA concentration measured after DNA extraction
Method used to measure the DNA concentration after DNA extraction
Total DNA quantity calculated from the DNA concentration measured after extraction
Reference code given by the sequencing centre to the sample upon the beginning of the analysis
Reference code given by EMO BON to the sample during packaging and cataloguing
Analysis workflow followed: METAGENOMIC, GENOMIC, GENOMIC SINGLE CELL, TRANSCRIPTOMIC, TRANSCRIPTOMIC SINGLE CELL, METATRANSCRIPTOMIC, SYNTHETIC, VIRAL RNA, OTHER
Required_value_and_units: text, select from the list: METAGENOMIC, GENOMIC, GENOMIC SINGLE CELL, TRANSCRIPTOMIC, TRANSCRIPTOMIC SINGLE CELL, METATRANSCRIPTOMIC, SYNTHETIC, VIRAL RNA, OTHER

Term_Definition: Reference name given by the sequencing centre to a specific sequencing run
Filename given by the sequencing centre to the sequencing reads produced

Metadata_term_full_name: correspoding prokaryotes mock community sequencing reads filename
Term_Definition: Filename given by the sequencing centre to the sequencing reads produced by the prokaryote mock community included in the same sequencing run as the sample

Metadata_term_full_name: correspoding eukaryotes mock community sequencing reads filename
Term_Definition: Filename given by the sequencing centre to the sequencing reads produced by the eukaryote mock community included in the same sequencing run as the sample

Metadata_term_full_name: relevant electronic resources for the sequencing work
Term_Definition: Relevant electronic resources for the sequencing molecular work. Resources may be provided for any of the steps/methods followed

Metadata_term_full_name: relevant standard operating procedures for the sequencing work
Term_Definition: Standard operating procedures used in the sequencing molecular work

Umbrella study accession number is a unique identifier given to an umbrella study once the sample is registered to ENA (European Nucleotide Archive). It refers to a specific umbrella study and connected to all the projects, samples, sequencing runs and data included.

Project accession number is a unique identifier given to aproject once the sample is registered to ENA (European Nucleotide Archive). It refers to a specific project and connected to all the samples, sequencing runs and data included.

A unique identifier assigned to a material sample according to EMO BON Handbook. This identifier will characterize the sample during nucleic acid extraction, and subsequent sequencing or biobanking. This identifier consists of 5 terms: 1) Project (-EMO BON-) 2) Sampling Site ID; that is the Observatory ID (for example -SMN99-) supplemented with the sampling site indicator (-Wa- for water column, -So- for soft substrates and -Ha- for hard substrates) 3) Sampling Campaign Date formated as -YYMMDD-.For example -220315- would be the campaign on 15 March 2022. Especially for Hard substrates, both the deployment and retrieval dates have to be recorded formated as YYMMDD-YYMMDD 4) Size fraction (Wa: 3 um / 0.2 um / 20 um / 200 um) or organisms collected (So: -micro- for microorganisms, -meio- for meiobenthos and -macro- for macrobenthos) or ARMS fraction (Ha: -SF- for sessile fraction, -MF05- for motile fraction sieved through 0.5 mm, -MF01- for motile fraction sieved through 0.1 mm) 5) Replicate (number 1-4). For labelling the negative control, this term will be replaced by the notation -blank- in parenthesis.
Required_value_and_units: text in specific format (unique sample id)

Term_Definition: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample during the analysis and specifies an analysis stage, a step or a differentiation in the pipeline. The source material identifiers analysis consists of the source material identifiers ("source_mat_id") and a short analysis identifier. The short analysis identifier can be "metag" for metagenomics, "its metab" for ITS metabarcoding, "2nd time" for a sample that failed and is analyzed again.
Required_value_and_units: text in specific format (unique sample id and analysis id)
